abstracts.cdata!:
Through education, and skills
            development, the Human Resources Development Project will
            implement a program of capacity building, in order to
            re-dress, and develop a critical mass of trained human
            resources in Rwanda. The components will: 1) support the
            Community-Based Rehabilitation and Development Program
            (CSRDP), through classrooms rehabilitation, provision of
            equipment, and construction of new schools, through a
            participatory community approach, and, strengthen
            responsiveness of local governments via capacity building of
            key institutions in charge of decentralization; 2) raise the
            quality of education, through the School Quality Improvement
            Program, which include teacher training, provision of
            textbooks, and teaching materials, in addition to
            monitoring, and evaluation; 3) protect children, youth, and
            teachers through the HIV/AIDS prevention, and education
            component, in an effort to promote knowledge, through
            educational activities, and information dissemination. The
            Ministry of Education will expand AIDS management, and
            technical capacity, and, counseling, testing, and caring
            will be supported through non-governmental organizations,
            and health facilities; 4) strengthen capacities for
            educational management, reinforcing the system of
            decentralization, and inspections; and, 5) provide technical
            support, and, monitoring and evaluation for effective coordination.
